frontend

Class TabbedSlogoView

  • java.lang.Object
    • frontend.TabbedSlogoView

  • public class TabbedSlogoView
extends java.lang.Object
    This class sets up everything necessary for the Slogo IDE. This is where much of the Slogo-specific code is placed, in order to allow all of the other classes to create a reusable API. The TabbedSlogoView sets up 1) the IDE that the user interacts with in order to control the turtle, 2) the visualization of the turtle, 3) the connections between the two (the model), and then displays the IDE and the turtle visualization. The TabbedSlogoView creates tabbed panes for both the IDE and the simulation (turtle visualization), and it synchronizes these TabPanes so that when the user changes tabs on one pane, the other one automatically switches as well. It also synchronizes the language and stylesheets of each. This allows the user to arrange the workspace any way they want to in order to best use screen space, while preventing the code from becoming Spaghetti code; i.e. the editor does not have a reference to the simulation because it does not control the simulation (it controls the model), and vice versa.
    Author:
    Dylan Peters

    • Constructor Detail

      • TabbedSlogoView

        public TabbedSlogoView()
        Creates a new instance of TabbedSlogoView. All values are set to defaults.

      • TabbedSlogoView

        public TabbedSlogoView(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Creates a new instance of TabbedSlogoView. The stage that is passed as a parameter is used as the stage for the editor, and the simulation is placed in a new stage. This method allows the Application class to pass its stage to the TabbedSlogoView.
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage used to display the editor of the IDE.
